that by which anything is known or called; a name.
the act of calling, inviting; an invitation.
to get, be known by, a name.
a requesting to come; the act of inviting; an invitation.
the act of calling on a God, a spirit, etc. to be present in an idol being worshipped.
a call or dare to take part in a duel, contest, etc.; a challenge.
to call; to invite; to summon.
to invocate a god, a spirit, etc. to abide in an idol.
the written form with which a person is invited; an invitation card.
a man who calls or invites.
invited; called in by.
a man who is invited; an invitee.
a woman who is invited; an invitee.
to call, invite, summon a person to be present or to come.
to invocate a god, a spirit, etc. to abide in an idol.
a name; an appellation.
to exercise authority over; to rule; to administer; to direct; to control; to manage, to govern.
to obtain; to get; to have; to possess.
to enjoy; to use with delight and satisfaction.
to protect; to faster; to take care of.

ಆಳ್ದ āḷda one who ruled or governed; a king; a lord; 2. a man with reference to the woman to whom he is married; a husband; ಆಳ್ದನಚಕ್ರ āḷdanacakra a main guard or a trusted soldier (of a king etc.) (chiefly used as a title meaning literarily - 'the sharp discus weapon in the hand of the king'); ಆಳ್ದಳ್ āḷdaḷa mistress - a) a woman who ruled others or had control, authority or power over something; b) a woman who was head of a household; 2. a woman in her relationship to her husband; a wife; ಆಳ್ವನ್ āḷvan he who rules; a king; a lord; ಆಳಿಬಾಳಿದವ āḷibāḷidava an elderly man with rich experience and wisdom; ಆಳ್ದೊತ್ತು āḷdottu to seize and press hard; ಆಳ್ದುಂಬರ್ಪರ್ āḷdumbarpar (pl.) those who occupy, seize and rule over.
to go under the surface of a liquid; to plunge or sink oneself in to water etc.
to be engaged or absorbed deeply (as in a work, sorrow, etc.); 3) to be or to go within.
to cause to drown.
to fall losing one's strength; to collapse.
a human being; a woman or a man.
(gen.) a man.
a man of capacity; a capable man; a manly person.
a soldier.
a member of that branch of an army consisting of soldiers trained and equipped to fight chiefly on foot; a foot-soldier.
a disciple.
a person employed to perform services, esp. household duties, for another; a servant.
a chess piece of the lowest value which can be moved only forward and one square at a time (or two squares on its first move), and which captures with a diagonal move; a pawn.
a measure of depth or height, varying from 5 feet to six feet.
ಆಳಾಗಿಸಿಕೊ āḷāgisiko to make (another person) a servant; to make a person a slave for oneself; ಆಳಾಳ್ āḷāḷa slave of a slave; a very humble person.
the distance from the top downward, from the surface inward or from front to back; depth.
profundity of thought; intellectual depth.
that which cannot be seen from outside; inner feelings, thought, secret, etc.

ಆಳಕ್ಕೆ ಇಳಿ āḷakke iḷi to go deep into (water or a subject being studied); 2. to probe deep; to examine intently; to search for the root or cause of; ಆಳವಾಗಿ ಆಭ್ಯಾಸಮಾಡು āḷavāgi abhyāsamāḍu to study and understand thoroughly; ಆಳವಾದ ಪಾಂಡಿತ್ಯ āḷavāda paṇḍitya learning acquired by reading and deep study; erudite scholarship; ಆಳನೋಡಿ ಹಾರು āḷanōḍi hāru to study the pros and cons of an undertaking before taking it up; look before you leap.
the act or an instance of cheating; deceiving.
especially.
excessively.
the tree Oroxylum indicum ( = Bignonia indica) of Bignoniaceae family; Indian trumpet flower tree.
a postal mail or message sent through a person.
= ಆಳಂಬನ - 1.
that which supports; a prop; a stay; a support.
a help; support received from another.
the act of hanging or the state of being suspended.
= ಆಳಂಬೆ.

any of various rapidly growing, fleshy fungi, typically having a stalk capped with an umbrellalike top; esp., a gill or pore fungus (some of which are edible such as Agaricus campestris of Agaricaceae family ); a mushroom.
the act of taking hold of; an instance of seizing; seizure.
the act of killing (esp. an animal at a sacrifice).
the act of completely eliminating; a removal without leaving any trace behind.
the rules and regulations governing the service of a servant.
characterised by violent action, motion, agitation, disturbance or irregularity; boisterous or disorderly; rough.
a bundle of lies; a false network; a spurious net.
the lowest level or point; very bottom; rock bottom.
foot soldiers collectively; esp., that branch of an army consisting of soldiers trained and equipped to fight chiefly on foot; infantry.
a heavy post to tie an elephant to.
